problem.p: This is a concept question, provided to check your understanding of the previous lecture video clips.
Which of the following are true?

choice.text: The probability of each measurement outcome after applying a Clifford circuit is always one divided by a power of 2.
The normalizer of the stabilizer groups in the construction of Gottesman-Knill theorem have more elements than the stabilizer group itself.
The Gottesman-Knill theorem still holds if we measure the qubits in the [mathjaxinline]X[/mathjaxinline] basis.
An arbitrary code may be transformed to a trivial code using a Clifford operation.
